titles.title: Professional Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1993
A bill to provide that professional baseball teams and leagues composed of such teams shall be subject to the antitrust laws.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2416-2419)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Judiciary. Failed to approve for reporting.

bill.summary: 3/4/1993--Introduced. Professional Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1993 - Amends the Clayton Act to make the antitrust laws applicable to the business of organized professional baseball, except as provided in the Sports Broadcasting Act of 1961.
